<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Ps. 75, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Ps. 103, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1413.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of indef. long time. </sense><sense id="n1413.7" n="A" level="2"> Of the future, <hi rend="ital">lasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everlasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterni parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc spero aeternam inter nos gratiam fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternus luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:924" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 924</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1003" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1003</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 369</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rab. 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis sacerdotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitat Lentulum aeternis tenebris vinculisque mandare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—Comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">spero me ob hunc nuntium aeternum adepturum cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>. Esp. of Rome: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterna urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>the Eternal City</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 72</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 16, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:55" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, 1140</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: nec est ulli ligno aeternior natura. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterniora mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1413.8" n="B" level="2"> Of the past, <hi rend="ital">of yore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ablue corpus alluvii aeternisque sordibus squalidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1413.9" n="III" level="1"> Adv. phrases. </sense><sense id="n1413.10" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">in aeter-num</orth>. </sense><sense id="n1413.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everlastingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vivat in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nomen mihi est in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus in aeternum permanet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivet in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tu es sacerdos in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habebit remissionem in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1413.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of indef. long time, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">always</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs in aeternum condita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges in aeternum latae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(proverbia) durant in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delatores non in praesens tantum, sed in aeternum repressisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:35" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(famulos) possidebitis in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:25:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 25, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(servus) serviet tibi usque in aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sceleris memoria maneat in aeternum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1413.13" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">aeternum</orth>. </sense><sense id="n1413.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedet aeternumque sedebit Infelix Theseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aeternum illum reciperes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 15</bibl></cit> (prob. here an adv.).—</sense><sense id="n1413.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of indef. long time, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">always</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serviet aeternum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1413.16" n="C" level="2"> Of what is continually repeated, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again and again</hi> (as in colloq. Engl., <hi rend="ital">everlastingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternally</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">glaebaque versis Aeternum frangenda bidentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens janitor Aeternum latrans (of Cerberus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 401</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1413.17" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">aeternō</orth>, meton., of indef. long time, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetually</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viret aeterno hunc fontem igneum contegens fraxinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">BVSTA TVTA AETERNO MANEANT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4517</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aethalus: <entryFree id="n1414" type="main" key="aetha^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aethălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai)qa/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n1414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of grape in Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the soot-grape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aether: <entryFree id="n1415" type="main" key="aether"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aether</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (sometimes Gr. <sense id="n1415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> aetheros; <case>acc.</case> reg. Gr. aethera; and so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:225" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:525" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 525</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but poetry and prose of that per. also use aetherem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 58</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> in late Lat. aethera, Ven. Fort. Carm. 3, 9, 7), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai)qh/r</foreign> [v. aestas], <hi rend="ital">the upper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ether.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1415.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n1415.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (opp. aër, the lower atmospheric air): restat ultimus omnia cingens et coërcens caeli complexus, qui idem aether vocatur, extrema ora et determinatio mundi; <cit><quote lang="la">in quo cum admirabilitate maxima igneae formae cursus ordinatos definiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(astra) oriuntur in ardore caelesti, qui aether vel caelum nominatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1415.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the poets, </sense><sense id="n1415.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Heaven</hi>: Id, quod nostri caelum memorant, Graii perhibent aethera, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 17</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 87 Rib.): <cb n="AETH" /> famā super aethera notus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 379</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex aetheris altus Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna profundi aetheros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:524" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 524</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n1415.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Air</hi>, in gen.: clamor ad caelum volvendus per aethera vagit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 520 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignem ignes procudunt aetheraque aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1115</bibl></cit>: ferar per liquidum aethera Vates, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudoque sub aetheris axe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 512</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes liquidum trans aethera vectae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:513 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 513 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n1415.6" n="3" level="3"> In opp. to the lower world, <hi rend="ital">the upper world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethere in alto duros perferre labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 436</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n1415.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The brightness surrounding a deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethere plena corusco Pallas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:183" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1415.8" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aether</orth> <itype>personified</itype>, <hi rend="ital">son of Chaos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Cœlum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17 al.</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41</bibl>. So in the poets often: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater omnipotens Aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 325</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aetherius: <entryFree id="n1416" type="main" key="aethe^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aethĕrĭus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">aethĕrĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">aiqe/rios</foreign> [aether], <sense id="n1416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the ether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ethereal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1416.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera aetheriis affixa cavernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(truncus) vivit et aetherias vitalīs suscipit auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissima aetheriaque natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: post ignem aetheriā domo Subductum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1416.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1416.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celestial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 858</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <trans><tr>the shade spread through the heavens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus mons aetherio vertice,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which touches heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: aetherios animo conceperat ignes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">heavenly inspiration</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)nqousiasmo/s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:473" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 473</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1416.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the air</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:682" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 682</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1416.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the upper world</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesci aurā Aetheriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 546</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetherior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:68" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 68</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
aethiopia: <entryFree id="n1417" type="main" key="Aethi^o^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aethĭŏpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)qiopi/a</foreign> [v. Aethiops], <sense id="n1417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Ethiopia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a country in Africa on both sides of the equator.</hi> Its limits cannot be accurately defined; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 11, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aethĭŏpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ethiopian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aethiopis: <entryFree id="n1418" type="greek" key="aethi^o^pi^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aethĭŏpĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai)qiopi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n1418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of sage</hi>, prob. Salvia Aethiopis, Linn., <hi rend="ital">Ethiopian sage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 3, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aethiopissa: <entryFree id="n1419" type="main" key="Aethi^o^pissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aethĭŏpissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n1419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Ethiopian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Eust. Ep. 22, 1</bibl>; from</sense></entryFree>
aethiops: <entryFree id="n1420" type="main" key="Aethi^o^ps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aethĭŏps</orth> (i long, Aethīops, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 18</bibl>), <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)qi/oy</foreign> [the Gr. geographers derived this word from <foreign lang="greek">ai)/qw-w)/y</foreign>, and applied it to all the <sense id="n1420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sunburnt</hi>, dark-complexioned races above Egypt]. </sense><sense id="n1420.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">an Ethiopian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 78, 80, § 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1420.2" n="B" level="2"> Appel. </sense><sense id="n1420.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A black man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">derideat Aethiopem albus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aethiopas videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 52, § 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1420.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blockhead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc homine an cum stipite Aethiope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:600" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 600</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1420.5" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ethiopian;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aethiopes lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir Aethiops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aethiopus: <entryFree id="n1421" type="main" key="Aethi^o^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aethĭŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Aethiops: rhinoceros velut Aethiopus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 689</bibl> P.</entryFree>
aethon: <entryFree id="n1422" type="main" key="Aetho_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aethōn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai)/qwn</foreign> (burning). In mythology, <sense id="n1422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a horse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1422.1" n="I" level="1"> In the chariot of Phœbus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1422.2" n="II" level="1"> In that of Pallas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1422.3" n="III" level="1"> In that of Aurora, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1</bibl>. c.—</sense><sense id="n1422.4" n="IV" level="1"> In that of Pluto, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
aethra: <entryFree id="n1423" type="main" key="aethra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aethra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai)/qra</foreign> [v. aestas], <sense id="n1423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the upper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene sky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetheris splendor, qui sereno caelo conspicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 585</bibl></cit> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): flammea, Jul. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 4</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 228 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">siderea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1423.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like aether, <hi rend="ital">the sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgere in aethram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volans rubrā ales in aethrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 247</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:103" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:135 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 135 al.</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 42</bibl>, the correct read. is <hi rend="ital">aethere</hi>, B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1424" type="main" key="Aethra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aethra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)/qra</foreign>. <sense id="n1424.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Oceanus and Tethys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Hyas</hi> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 192" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 192</bibl> called <hi rend="ital">Pleione</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:171" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 171</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1424.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Piltheus and mother</hi> <cb n="AEVU" /> <hi rend="ital">of Theseus</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 131</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 37" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aetiologia: <entryFree id="n1425" type="greek" key="aeti^o^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aetĭŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai)tiologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n1425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allegation of reasons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bringing of proofs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aetites: <entryFree id="n1426" type="greek" key="a_e^ti_te_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āĕtītēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)eti/ths</foreign> (from <foreign lang="greek">a)eto/s</foreign>, eagle), <sense id="n1426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone found in the nest of the eagle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagle-stone</hi>, to us unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:130" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 44, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aetitis: <entryFree id="n1427" type="greek" key="a_e^ti_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āĕtītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)eti=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n1427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of the eagle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aetna: <entryFree id="n1428" type="main" key="Aetna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (in Gr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, in good MSS. of Ov.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)/tnh</foreign> [<foreign lang="greek">ai)/qw</foreign>, to burn]. <sense id="n1428.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The celebrated volcano of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mongibello</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Ætna</hi>, in the interior of which, acc. to fable, was the forge of Vulcan, where the Cyclopes forged thunderbolts for Jupiter, and under which the latter buried the monster Typhōeus.—Form Aetna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:596" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 596</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:275" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 275</bibl>.—Form Aetne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:491" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 491</bibl> Riese.— </sense><sense id="n1428.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nymph in Sicily</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 584</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1428.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town at the foot of Mt. Ætna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aetnaeus: <entryFree id="n1429" type="main" key="Aetnaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Aetna</etym>. <sense id="n1429.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to Ætna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <trans><tr>the Cyclopes who forged in Mt. Ætna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:16:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 16, 21</bibl></cit>: Deus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Vulcan</hi>, who is said to have had his forge in Mt. Ætna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:420" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 420</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetnaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those who dwell on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near Mt. Ætna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 1</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n1429.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, pars pro toto, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:196" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aetnensis: <entryFree id="n1430" type="main" key="Aetnensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the town of Ætna</hi> (at the foot of Mt. Ætna, v. Strab. 6, p. 185): <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ætna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aetolia: <entryFree id="n1431" type="main" key="Aeto_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetōlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)twli/a</foreign>, <sense id="n1431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a province in Middle Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Locri and Acarnania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 37</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n1431.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetōlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ætolian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <trans><tr>the Calydonian boar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 270</bibl> sqq.): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n1431.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetōlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)twli/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an Ætolian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsā Aetolide Dejanirā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 131</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n1431.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetōlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for Ætolicus: heros, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diomedes</hi>, who first reigned in Ætolia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 461</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1431.4" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ae-tōlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)twlo/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Ætolian</hi>: arma, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Diomedes</hi>, who first reigned in Ætolia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 528</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:484" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 484</bibl>: urbs, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Arpi in Apulia</hi>, built by Diomedes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 239</bibl>; hence: Arpi Aetoli. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 28</bibl>: plagae, <hi rend="ital">hunting-nets</hi>, with reference to Meleager and the Calydonian chase, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 46</bibl> Schmid.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aetōli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ætolia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Capt. prol. 24</bibl> Fleck.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 308</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aevitas: <entryFree id="n1432" type="main" key="aevi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aevĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aevum</etym> (an old word, = aetas, which is contr. from it), <sense id="n1432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the time through which a person lives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a thing lasts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the time of existence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1432.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: qua voluptate aevitatis extimam attigit metam aevitas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 193, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores populi aevitates, suboles, familias pecuniasque censento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: SI MORBVS AEVITASVE VITIVM ESCIT, Leg. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1432.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1432.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the future, <hi rend="ital">time unending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immortality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed etiam mortales deos ad aevitatem temporis edidit,</quote> <trans><tr>for endless ages</tr>, <tr>to endure forever</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1432.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the past: <cit><quote lang="la">quid operis aut negotii celebrans anteacti temporis decurrerit aevitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>the time of yore</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aeviternus: <entryFree id="n1433" type="main" key="aevi^ternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aevĭternus</orth>, = aeternus, q. v.</entryFree>
aevum: <entryFree id="n1434" type="main" key="aevum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aevum</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">aevom</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; but <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 561</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:603" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 603</bibl> [<foreign lang="greek">ai)w/n</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ai)e/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">ai)e/n, a)ei/, a)i/dios</foreign>; Goth. aivs = time, aiv = ever, aiveins = everlasting; Germ. ewig, Ewigkeit; Eng. aye, ever]. <sense id="n1434.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1434.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">never-ending time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternity;</hi> per aevom, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 634</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:950 al" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 950 al.</bibl>—Hence of the future: <cit><quote lang="la">in aevum,</quote> <trans><tr>for all time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 41, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos peribimus in aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,050:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Bar. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1434.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in a more restricted sense of a definite time, period, <hi rend="ital">lifetime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">age</hi>: aevom agitare, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 308 Vahl.): in armis aevom agere, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 49</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 110 Rib.); so, aevom degere, <pb n="65" /> <cb n="AFFA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1439</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1430</bibl></cit>: meum si quis te percontabitur aevum, <hi rend="ital">my age</hi> or <hi rend="ital">time of life</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum omne et breve et fragile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:78:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 78, 2</bibl></cit>: flos aevi, <hi rend="ital">the bloom of life</hi> (cf. aetas, I.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 435</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">integer aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:338" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 338</bibl></cit>.—Also (like aetas, q. v. I.) for <hi rend="ital">old age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevo confectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsitus aevo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis aevoque soluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 712</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1434.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1434.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Age</hi> or <hi rend="ital">generation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter aevo functus (of Nestor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia nostri aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostro aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 10, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum tot aevis incorruptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n1434.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The men living in the same age</hi> (cf. aetas, II. C.): <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus consensus aevi judicaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1434.6" n="C" level="2"> In a wider sense, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiata dentibus aevi omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae per tantum aevi occulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aex: <entryFree id="n1435" type="greek" key="Aex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aex</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai)/c</foreign> (Goat), <sense id="n1435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a rocky island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Chius and Tenus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aex nomine a specie caprae, repente e medio mari exsiliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
afer: <entryFree id="n1436" type="main" key="A_fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āfer</orth>, <itype>fra, frum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. Africa</etym>, <sense id="n1436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea between Africa and Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 289</bibl></cit>: avis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a Numidian hen</hi>, in high estimation on account of its size and rareness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:53" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Afro Murice tinctae lanae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Gœtulia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 181</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:318" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 318</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Āfer</orth>, <hi rend="ital">an African</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ă_fri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Africans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitientes Afri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: discincti, <hi rend="ital">ungirded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unwarlike</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 724</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirus Afer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">medius liquor Secernit Europen ab Afro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from Africa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affaber: <entryFree id="n1437" type="main" key="affa^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-făber</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n1437.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepared ingeniously</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious</hi>: affabrum: fabrefactum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 28</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfā^brē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ingeniously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfabre atque antiquo artificio factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1009</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n1437.1" n="II" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> sense, <hi rend="ital">skilled in art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras adfabra rerum vel natura vel industria peperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affabilis: <entryFree id="n1438" type="main" key="affa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affābĭlis</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adfari</etym>, <sense id="n1438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be easily spoken to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy of access</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 6, 8</bibl>: cum in omni sermone omnibus adfabilem esse se vellet, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfabilis, blandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dictu adfabilis ulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 621</bibl></cit> (cf. Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem nec adfari queas): adfabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfabilem te facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> prob. not used.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Spart. ap. Carac. 3: adfabilissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affabilitas: <entryFree id="n1439" type="hapax" key="affa_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affābĭlĭtas</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adfabilis</etym>, <sense id="n1439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of</hi> affabilis, <hi rend="ital">affability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitas adfabilitasque sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affabiliter: <entryFree id="n1440" type="main" key="affa_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. affabilis.</entryFree>
affabre: <entryFree id="n1441" type="main" key="affa_^bre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affā^brē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. affaber, I.</entryFree>
affabricatus: <entryFree id="n1442" type="hapax" key="affa_^bri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affā^brĭcātus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> <etym><mood>Part.</mood>, as if from adfabrico</etym>, <sense id="n1442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fitted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">added to by art</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo quasi adfabricata natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 6:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affamen: <entryFree id="n1443" type="main" key="affa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affāmen</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>adfari</etym>, <sense id="n1443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accosting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">address</hi> (in App. for the usual adfatus): <cit><quote lang="la">blando adfamine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 23</bibl></cit> Elm.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>, p. 272, 39.</sense></entryFree>
affaniae: <entryFree id="n1444" type="main" key="affa_ni^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affānĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. adfari</etym>, <sense id="n1444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifling talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle jests</hi>: dicta futilia, gerrae; <cit><quote lang="la">only in two passages in App.: affanias adblaterare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221, 25</bibl></cit> Elm.: <cit><quote lang="la">effutire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 243, 14 ib.</sense></entryFree>
affatim: <entryFree id="n1445" type="main" key="affa^tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affătim</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym><bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 123</bibl>, cites fatim = abundanter; cf.: fatiscor, defatiscor, fatigo; Corss. Ausspr. I. p. 158, refers fatim to the same root as <foreign lang="greek">xati/s, xh=ros</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n1445.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enough</hi> (so that one desires no more, therefore subjective; while <hi rend="ital">satis</hi> signifies sufficient, so that one needs nothing more, therefore objective, Doed. Syn. I. p. 108 sq.): adfatim edi, bibi, lusi, Liv. Andron. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 11</bibl> Müll., after Hom. Od. 15, 372 (Com. Rel. p. 4 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">edas de alieno quantum velis, usque adfatim,</quote> <trans><tr>till you have enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: miseria una uni quidem homini est adfatim, <cb n="AFFE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 61</bibl> (where adfatim, as sometimes also satis, abunde, frustra, is constr. as an adj.): <cit><quote lang="la">eisdem seminibus homines adfatim vescuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfatim satiata (aquila),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfatim satisfacere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare commeatum adfatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de cytiso adfatim diximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>.—Acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 11</bibl>, Terence uses it (in a passage not now extant) for ad lassitudinem, <hi rend="ital">to weariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiety</hi>, which may be derived from the etym. above given.—Sometimes, like abunde and satis, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.;</hi> v. Roby, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">1294, 1296, and Rudd. II. p. 317: divitiarum adfatim est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1445.1" n="II" level="1"> In later Lat. before an adj. (cf. abunde), <hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfatim onustus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221, 31</bibl></cit> Elm.: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae adfatim multae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6</bibl></cit>.!*? The poet and gram. Annianus, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl>, accented the word a/dfatim, while at an earlier period it was pronounced adfa/tim, since it was considered as two words; cf. Doed. Syn. I. p. 110.</sense></entryFree>
affatus: <entryFree id="n1446" type="main" key="affa_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affātus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <mood>Part.</mood> of adfari.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1447" type="main" key="affa_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affātus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>adfari</etym>, <sense id="n1447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">addressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">address</hi> (class. only in the poets; <cit><quote lang="la">later also in prose): quo nunc reginam ambire furentem Audeat adfatu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfatus reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 187" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora solvere ad adfatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:340 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 340 al.</bibl></cit>—In prose, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 4, 23</bibl>; Cod. Imp. Leo, 1, 26, 6 al.</sense></entryFree>
affectatio: <entryFree id="n1448" type="main" key="affecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectātĭo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adfecto</etym>, <sense id="n1448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striving after</hi> something (in a good or bad sense; for the most part only in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n1448.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia sapientiae amor est et adfectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna caeli adfectatione compertum, i. e. perscrutatione,</quote> <trans><tr>investigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20, 18, § 82</bibl></cit> (but Jan reads <hi rend="ital">adsectatio</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 56, § 154</bibl></cit>: Nervii circa adfectationem Germanicae originis (<hi rend="ital">in the endeavor to pass for Germans</hi>), ultro ambitiosi sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>aspiring to the empire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1448.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">a striving to give a certain character</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quality to discourse without possessing the ability to do it</hi>, also <hi rend="ital">an inordinate desire to say something striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ad malam adfectationem) pertinent, quae in oratione sunt tumida, exsilia, praedulcia, abundantia, arcessita, exsultantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est odiosius adfectatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:27" default="NO">8, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:54" default="NO">9, 3, 54</bibl>; 10, 1, 82; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
affectator: <entryFree id="n1449" type="main" key="affecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectātor</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that strives for</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">justi amoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">nimius risūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:3 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 3 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
affectatrix: <entryFree id="n1450" type="hapax" key="affecta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectātrix</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adfectator</etym>, <sense id="n1450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that strives for</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia adfectatrix veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affectatus: <entryFree id="n1451" type="main" key="affecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectātus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from affecto.</entryFree>
affecte: <entryFree id="n1452" type="main" key="affecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. afficio, <sense id="n1452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
affectio: <entryFree id="n1453" type="main" key="affecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adficio</etym>. <sense id="n1453.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The relation to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposition toward a thing produced in a person by some influence</hi> (in this and the two foll. signif. almost peculiar to the philos. lang. of Cic.): comparantur ea, quae aut majora aut minora aut paria dicuntur; <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus spectantur haec: numerus, species, vis, quaedam etiam ad res aliquas adfectio,</quote> <trans><tr>relation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 68</bibl></cit>, and § 70; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1453.1" n="II. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A change in the state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition of body or mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frame of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi> (only transient, while <hi rend="ital">habitus</hi> is lasting): <cit><quote lang="la">adfectio est animi aut corporis ex tempore aliqua de causa commutatio ut, laetitia, cupiditas, metus, molestia, morbus, debilitas, et alia, quae in eodem genere reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 5</bibl>; cf. 1, 2, 5, § 19. In Gellius = adfectus, as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pa/qos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1453.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A permanent state of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a frame of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a state of feeling</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dia/qesis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est adfectio animi constans conveniensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit> Kühn (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dia/qesis yuxh=s sumfw/nhs au(th=|</foreign>, Stob. Ecl. Eth. 2, p. 104); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:26:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 26, 65</bibl> Goer.: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi est vita mea utilior quam animi talis adfectio, neminem ut violem commodi mei gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 29</bibl></cit> Beier.—Also of body, as anal. to the mind, <hi rend="ital">a fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permanent constitution</hi>:<cb n="AFFE" />  tu qui detinieris summum bonum firma corporis adfectione contineri, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 27</bibl>.—And metaph. of the stars, <hi rend="ital">their position in respect to one another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a constellation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex qua adfectione caeli primum spiritum duxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 47</bibl></cit> (cf. affectus, a, um, B.).—</sense><sense id="n1453.3" n="C" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a favorable disposition toward any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-will</hi> (post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">simiarum generi praecipua erga fetum adfectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:54:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egit Nero grates patribus laetas inter audientium adfectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum magis quam aurum sequuntur, nullā adfectione animi, sed quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Artemisia Mausolum virum amāsse fertur ultra adfectionis humanae fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—Concr., <hi rend="ital">the loved object</hi>: adfectiones, <hi rend="ital">children</hi>, Cod. Th. 13, 9, 3.—</sense><sense id="n1453.4" n="D" level="2"> In the Lat. of the Pandects, <hi rend="ital">ability of willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi> (cf. 2. affectus, II. D.): <cit><quote lang="la">furiosus et pupillus non possunt incipere possidere, quia adfectionem tenendi non habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:16:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 16, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affectiosus: <entryFree id="n1454" type="hapax" key="affecti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>affectio</etym>, <sense id="n1454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of attachment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 19</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfectĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">affectionately</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 9, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
affecto: <entryFree id="n1455" type="main" key="affecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affecto</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n1455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [adficio]; constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1455.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strive after</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to exert one's self to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aim to do</hi>: adfectare est pronum animum ad faciendum habere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 2</bibl> Müll.—So, adfectare viam or iter, trop., <hi rend="ital">to enter on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take a way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order to arrive at a destined point</hi> (very freq. in Plaut. and Ter.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut me defraudes, ad eam rem adfectas viam,</quote> <trans><tr>you are on your way to this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi gladiatorio animo ad me adfectant viam,</quote> <trans><tr>set upon me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 71</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam viam munitet, quod iter adfectet, videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48</bibl></cit>.—So in other cases: <cit><quote lang="la">cur opus adfectas novum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: adfectare spem, <hi rend="ital">to cling to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 377</bibl>: navem, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum ubi nulla datur dextrā adfectare potestas (of the giant Polyphemus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 670</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1455.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To endeavor to make one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspire to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditiem, non adfluentiam adfectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,073:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Her. 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentiam verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegantiam Graecae orationis verbis Latinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>, n. 1 <hi rend="ital">extr.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: morbo adfectari, <hi rend="ital">to be seized</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attacked by disease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n1455.3" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to strive after</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">passionately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aim at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aspire to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominationes, Sall. Fragm. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 17: caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium in Latinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:539" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego sidereas adfecto tangere sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:132" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 132</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:138" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui esse docti adfectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1455.4" n="C" level="2"> In the histt., <hi rend="ital">to seek to draw to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to try to gain over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates formidine adfectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:39" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliarum societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 37, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1455.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To imitate a thing faultily</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">with dissimulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feign</hi> (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">crebrum anhelitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitationem antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam clementiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium carminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfectātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> in rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">farfetched; studied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scurrilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(gradatio) apertiorem habet artem et magis adfectatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectata et parum naturalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl></cit> (but in 12, 10, 45 the correct read. is effectius, acc. to Spald.).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfec-tātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">studiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
affector: <entryFree id="n1456" type="main" key="affector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affector</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n1456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">verb. dep.</hi> [adficio]. * </sense><sense id="n1456.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strive eagerly after</hi> something: adfectatus est regnum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 377</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n1456.2" n="2" level="3"> In later Lat., <hi rend="ital">to have an inclination for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become attached to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mulierem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affectuosus: <entryFree id="n1457" type="main" key="affectu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectŭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adfectus</etym>, in later Lat., <sense id="n1457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">love; affectionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piam adfectuosamque rem fecisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; so <pb n="66" /> <cb n="AFFE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Ep. 5, 2</bibl>; Tert. c. Marc. 5, 14.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfectŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">affectionately</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Ep. 3, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
affectus: <entryFree id="n1458" type="main" key="affectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <case>nom.</case> afficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1459" type="main" key="affectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>afficio</etym>. <sense id="n1459.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A state of body</hi>, and esp. <hi rend="ital">of mind produced in one by some influence</hi> (cf. affectio, I.), <hi rend="ital">a state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposition of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mood</hi>: adfectuum duae sunt species: alteram Graeci <foreign lang="greek">pa/qos</foreign> vocant, alteram <foreign lang="greek">h)=qos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis cujusque animi adfectus esset, talem esse hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubiis adfectibus errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversos adfectus exprimere, flentis et gaudentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl></cit>, n. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectu concitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus dulciores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:2" default="NO">1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7 al" default="NO">6, 1, 7 al.</bibl>—Of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">supersunt alii corporis adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1459.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1459.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compassion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sympathy</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">opes atque inopiam pari adfectu concupiscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res ampla domi similisque affectibus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectu jura corrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 6:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1459.3" n="B" level="2"> In Lucan and in later prose, meton. for <hi rend="ital">the beloved objects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the dear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loved ones</hi> (in <number>plur.</number>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">adfectio, II. C.): tenuit nostros Lesbos adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:Phars. 8:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> Phars. 8, 132</bibl></cit>: milites, quorum adfectus (<hi rend="ital">wives and children</hi>) in Albano monte erant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Maxim. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anton. Phil. 24</bibl>; hence, adfectus publici, <hi rend="ital">the judges</hi> as representatives of the people, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 2:17 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 2, 17 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n1459.4" n="C" level="2"> In Seneca and Pliny, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignoble passion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus sunt motus animi improbabiles subiti et concitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:79:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 79, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n1459.5" n="D" level="2"> In the Latin of the Pandects, <hi rend="ital">ability of willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volition</hi> (cf. affectio, II. D.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc edicto neque pupillum, neque furiosum teneri constat, quia adfectu carent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:54" default="NO">44, 7, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:19:section=2 al" default="NO">3, 5, 19, § 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
